<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: try {
PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter("output.txt");
for (int i = 0; i < Astronauts.length; i++) {
for (int j = 0; j < Astronauts[i].length; j++) {
writer.write(Astronauts[i][j].toString() + "\n");
}
}
writer.close();
} catch (Exception e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}

<<<explanation>>>: This code will write the contents of the array Astronauts to a text file named output.txt. It uses a for loop to iterate through each element of the array and write it to the file, along with a newline character at the end of each line. The PrintWriter object is used to write the contents of the array to the file.
